description.narrative: The proposed project involves supporting Banco Internacional (the Bank or BI) in establishing its agribusiness business unit to originate an SME focused agribusiness portfolio and support the development of a women-owned SME portfolio - high priority segments for IFC (the Project). The Project will provide dedicated Agri-SME and gender funding to BI, enabling it to increase its lending activities in the agricultural sector and develop its women-owned SME portfolio. In addition, the Project is expected to have a high development impact by helping an IFC existing client increase the range of financial products available to Chilean Agri-SMEs and farmers as well as women entrepreneurs.

The proposed transaction is expected to generate the following development impacts: - Increase the access to long term finance to farmers, Agri-SMEs and women-owned SMEs, which is highly needed in order for them to undertake capital investments; - Contribute to strengthen the food supply chain, job creation, productivity increase and rural economic development; - The proposed transaction would contribute to the formalization of Agri-SMEs and women-owned SMEs in the country as it will be a clear demonstration of the additional benefits such as having access to long-term financing at adequate terms in line with the business needs; - BI will comply with IFC''s E&S requirements and exclusion list in its underwriting process.
